metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8743 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Apache HTTP Server, in all releases prior to 2.2.32 and 2.4.25, was liberalin the whitespace accepted from requests and sent in response lines andheaders. Accepting these different behaviors represented a security concernwhen httpd participates in any chain of proxies or interacts with back-endapplication servers, either through mod_proxy or using conventional CGImechanisms, and may result in request smuggling, response splitting andcache pollution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8743` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.15').
apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.15').
